Revoke the environment secretary George Eustice decision to let a product containing the to treat sugar beet seed this year in an effort to protect the crop from a virus.  
Also we call for a complete ban on any product containing neonicotinoid thiamethoxam in the UK to protect bees.
attributes.additional_details: neonicotinoid thiamethoxam kill bees and without bees doing their jobs as pollinators we will not have food.

attributes.action: Ban the use of the neonicotinoid thiamethoxam.
attributes.background: We are at environmental crisis point .  The authority for emergency use of the neonicotinoid thiamethoxam in England must be withdrawn.
attributes.additional_details: In 2018 Michael Gove said: “the weight of evidence now shows the risks neonicotinoids pose to our environment, particularly to pollinators which play such a key part in our £100bn food industry, is greater than previously understood  and "We cannot afford to put our environmental standards at risk" . He promised that environmental standards will not “slip lower” than those of the EU post-Brexit yet only 9 days in and our environmental standards are being eroded

attributes.action: We need bees! Stop the use of Neonicotinoids on crops!
attributes.background: This was previously debated, and Neonicotinoids were banned (In 2015) as there is significant scientific evidence of the harmful and irreversible effect on bees. We need bees and insects for food crops as pollination is imperative to the continued production of farming.
attributes.additional_details: In 2017, then-environment secretary Michael Gove welcomed the EU ban on the pesticides, and promised that “unless the scientific evidence changes, the government will maintain these increased restrictions post-Brexit”. How are we going backwards?

attributes.action: Cancel GCSEs and A Levels in 2022
attributes.background: The Government should cancel GCSEs and A Levels in 2022 due to the disruption of Covid-19.By the time students go back to normal learning, many months of 2020 and,now 2021 as well will have passed since schools were closed to most pupils.This has already had a huge impact on the studying of so many.
attributes.additional_details: Students in the UK have already missed hundreds of hours of learning In the 2 lockdowns since March 2020. This has had a huge effect. Some pupils don’t have the essential resources: a working computer, textbooks, stationary, etc. Many don’t have a proper learning environment or struggle to study curriculum properly in the circumstances leaving gaps in studies,therefore results will most certainly not reflect the true efforts of pupils. Hence why I am writing to the Government to cancel GCSEs and A Levels which would be very unfair, considering all time and opportunities lost, and provide predicted grades to show the true reflections of students across the country.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/566760

attributes.action: Compensate uni students for the hardship of online learning with lenient marking
attributes.background: Make universities account for how difficult it has been for university students to study online with lenient grading. Courses have been kept to the same content and structure as before. Meaning high workloads including keeping up with course content and doing assignments and exams at the same time.
attributes.additional_details: University students have been kept in limbo in regards to covid and learning. Students doing A-levels and GCSE's have been given consideration for the difficulties faced due to school closures. The same must be given to those doing degrees, content is much harder to learn online especially when in higher education. Degrees are not meant to be self taught in this manner university students lack adequate learning environments. This has significantly impacted student's grades & academic performance

rejection.details:
Decisions about the assessment of university courses are a matter for individual universities, not the UK Government or Parliament.

The Office for Students has published guidance for providers about quality and standards during the coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic, which sets out its expectations regarding teaching and assessments: https://www.officeforstudents.org.uk/publications/guidance-for-providers-about-quality-and-standards-during-coronavirus-pandemic/.

If you have concerns about your university's arrangements for teaching and assessment you should raise these with your university or the Office for Students, which regulates the higher education sector.

attributes.action: Close nurseries during lockdown, alongside primary and secondary schools.
attributes.background: Close nurseries alongside primary and secondary schools during the lockdown.
attributes.additional_details:
Early years children are not able to socially distance. Even less so than in schools.  Despite their bubbles, there is a risk to young children and to all the staff working in these environments. 

The nurseries should be closed in line with primary and secondary schools to protect our children and the staff.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/566718

attributes.action: Imprison all prison officers & others that work at HMP for smuggling contraband
attributes.background: Prisoner officers and outside workers are not being punished enough for smuggling drugs, mobile phones , contraband, and other prohibited items into the prison estate. During lockdown due to covit one would think there would be much less of drugs & mobile phones being smuggled in. But it is worse
attributes.additional_details: ALL prison officers & other outside workers must be imprisoned for minimum of 6 months no matter what they get caught with. If it's illegal they must face a prison sentence. Our prisons need to be safe & healthy places for inmates to serve their sentences and leave rehabilitated. Jailing these prison officers and outside workers will make others think twice & prisons will be a safer environment for both the good and fair officer's & inmates.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. We're not sure whether you want prison sentences for the smuggling of all goods or just for illegal goods such as drugs. 
	
You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.background: Ensure all missed education is covered by allowing secondary school pupils to resit the lost year due to Covid19
attributes.additional_details: Ensure all children repeat the 2019/2020 school year. The first lockdown was hugely detrimental to all children. They are struggling to catch up on the learning they missed and the classroom environment at present is just not as effective with all these restrictions. In order to learn effectively children need to closely interact with their teachers and less and less of this is happening right now and sadly it shows within their eduction.

attributes.action: Make shops use less plastic to save the environment.
attributes.background: Contact large companies like Tesco and Aldi and check up on how much plastic they already use. Then you could explain to them how they could get rid of the plastic e.g. use cardboard instead of plastic to store the eggs in, or cellulose, which is very similar to plastic but is compostable.
attributes.additional_details: I think the world is getting worse everyday and just making a move like this could help a lot. I heard that some of the plastic we put in the recycling bins don't always get recycled. I am 13 years old and I want to grow up in a green environment and stop plastic affecting people's lives. If we want to change, we change now.

attributes.action: Ban fipronil and imidacloprid from pet flea products as they kill river insects
attributes.background: One flea treatment contains enough pesticide to kill 60 million bees! The washing of pets flushes chemicals into rivers, while dogs swimming is another pathway for contamination. Rivers are being polluted. The government is requested to ban the use of these products in all pet flea treatments.
attributes.additional_details: Almost 4,000 samples recently gathered by the Environment Agency in 20 English rivers showed Fipronil was detected in 99% of samples and a highly toxic breakdown product called fipronil sulfone was found in 97%. The average concentrations were 5 and 38 times higher than their chronic toxicity limits, respectively. Imidacloprid was found in 66% of the samples and was above toxicity limits in seven of the 20 rivers.  Many pets are treated every month, whether needed or not.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/560905

attributes.additional_details: Keeping gyms open provides people to live a healthy lifestyle though out lockdown many of people have gained weight with high readings of BMI and put on more and more pounds, people are at risk of diabetes due to eating unhealthy or over eating for comfort, gym allows us to stay fit and helps us relief stress as go in to lockdown, gyms have put safety measures to ensure the environment is safe capping gym capacity of how many people are allowed in at one time, sanitation of hands.

attributes.action: Keep Swimming Pools Open through November Covid19 Lockdown
attributes.background: The opening of pools has proved to have been well managed and executed. Swimming pools offer a unique non-impact whole body exercise to both able bodied and disabled people of all ages within a light safe environment. The water contact is known to have positive mental health benefits.
attributes.additional_details: To prevent issues with mental and physical health and offer safe exercise environments. The Pool Water Treatment Advisory Group state that: “The available evidence shows that the physical effect of the pool water and an appropriate relationship between free chlorine and pH value should inactivate the virus within 15-30 seconds. The dilution of virus in the pool water volume will also reduce the risk of exposure and transmission.” Air circulation in pool halls is high to stop airborne infection.

attributes.action: Ecocide, Mayor John Biggs, Tower Hamlets
attributes.background: To curb the powers of elected mayors.  Remove from power Mayor John Biggs, usually personal views are not representative.  In Tower Hamlets, the continued form of ecocide, with the of the felling of trees, protected, ancient or otherwise, is against the values of The Climate Emergency.
attributes.additional_details: The taking out of a 500 yr old tree, The Bethnal Green Mulberry, raising to wasteland "The Limehouse Triangle" a nature reserve, deemed of special scientific interest. The felling of The Marsh Wall 8, deemed worthy of tree protection. The soon, decimation of Belmont Wharf, an organic community garden with surrounding trees now in danger.  The urban environment is precious, therefore should be preserved, should Mayor Biggs continue to ensure that a tree is an obstacle to progress what next.

rejection.details: We can't publish petitions about honours and appointments, which includes calling for people to be sacked or removed from office.

attributes.action: A complete overhaul of development planning guidelines .
attributes.background: Review and overhaul current residential planning guidelines to forcefully ensure greener and more sustainable development and communities across the country . End standardised repetitive new build housing developments that focus on profit only and minimise impact instead improving impact .
attributes.additional_details: Currently the construction industry particularly the new build housing sector developments are focused purely on developers profits . Often following standard designs that repeat across the country creating soulless hard landscaped developments with little to no thought to the natural environment . Focus should be on creating spaces that in balance and to improve the natural landscapes and utilising technology thats avaliable now . Individually designed spaces that will benefit the environment

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the UK Government or House of Commons to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about new developments currently being built, but it's not clear exactly what you want the Government to do about this.

We have published the following related petition, which you might like to sign:

Make it law for all new builds to include green energy solutions: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/332338

It's not clear how your request for new developments not to be based on standard designs could be implemented by the Government.

attributes.action: Make sports training a "reasonable excuse" for Adults to travel.
attributes.background: It has been announced today in the Welsh News that Children can attend sports training outside lockdown areas as the sports training will be a "reasonable excuse" to travel. This should be applied to adults taking part in sports training also.
attributes.additional_details: Mental Health in the UK was under pressure prior to COVID19, now following one lockdown and smaller local lockdowns,mental health continues to decline.The need to support mental wellbeing through physical activity is needed and many people find therapy in sports training. We need to be able to travel in order to train in a supportive environment and be able to stop further damage to physical and mental health.We should also allow adults to train together whether from lockdown local areas or not.

attributes.action: Give food companies a year to reduce their plastic packaging by at least 50%.
attributes.background:
Put pressure on food companies especially those who sell to supermarkets to reduce their plastic packaging.
Single use plastic is damaging the environment and wildlife. Alternatives like paper can be easily used.
attributes.additional_details: At the moment citizens are responsible for being the “demand” for products meaning we’re being blamed for choosing products with high plastic content. However there is not much of a choice when everything you find in the supermarket is covered in single use plastic polluting the world.

rejection.details:

attributes.action: Impose fines for discarding face coverings in an antisocial way.
attributes.background: Since the mandating of face covers, it has become apparent that some people are discarding their face coverings in an anti social manner. I have visited beaches, forests, parks and many other areas, both urban and rural, and have been disgusted at the total disrespect shown to the environment.
attributes.additional_details:
We should be able to go for walks, swim, picnic and exercise, without having to encounter used face coverings that not only make the immediate area unpleasant, but could potentially cause harm, both to people as well as wildlife.
I feel that a fine should be imposed on people caught discarding their face coverings in this way. Fines should be fixed penalties, say £100, doubling each time, up to a maximum, of say, £3200, every time a person is in breach of this rule.

rejection.details:
Littering is already a criminal offence with a maximum fine of £2,500. Fixed penalty notices (between £50-80) are also often used in lieu of prosecution in the courts.

We have already published a number of petitions calling for the Government to increase penalties and enforcement of littering rules, which you might like to sign:

Increase penalties, enforcement and education to tackle littering & fly tipping: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/324488

Introduce heavy fixed penalties starting at £1000 minimum for littering: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/334297

We have also published a petition calling on the Government to ban the use of disposable face masks and plastic gloves in public places, because of the environmental impact of these products: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/324857

Decisions about enforcement of fines and prosecutions for littering offences is a matter for the police and Crown Prosecution Service, not the Government or House of Commons.

attributes.action: Reduce tuition fees for students studying primarily from home
attributes.background: Reduce tuition fees for students that will be studying predominately from home as the quality on education will not be of the same standard as pre-COVID 19 teaching. Many students in the creative arts (dance, music & theatre etc) do not have a suitable environment to be educated from home.
attributes.additional_details: During COVID-19 University students were neglected in the governments plans to reopen leaving many students fearful of what this meant for their education. In the UK, university degrees are encouraged and needed for many jobs, meaning those attending university rely on the knowledge, support and resources of their chosen university to get a job post-university allowing them to contribute to the economy. Education from home won’t allow students to reach their full potential.

The government has decided that masks are not necessary in a school, 
We disagree as it is the best way to protect each other and keep us all safe, along with other safety measures such as social distancing.
attributes.additional_details:
Hundreds of children will be returning to school in September from different places all across the uk, it is simply too dangerous to enter an environment with lots of people without face coverings. 

Wearing a mask can prevent the virus from spreading to other people, so if absolutely everybody wore a mask the virus would not spread At all 


Help us keep our children and staff safe, sign this petition.

Rayer’s Petition:
Review littering in the U.K.

attributes.action: Ban the use of Palm Oil in UK manufactured chocolate.
attributes.background: I would like the Government to speak to UK chocolate manufacturers to eventually stop the use of Palm Oil in chocolate. Using Palm Oil threatens species like orangutans, as their habitats and food sources are getting lost due to deforestation. They will soon go extinct.
attributes.additional_details: I would like the Government to do this as it is not right to kill endangered animal’s habitats. It is possible to manufacture chocolate without Palm Oil as some less popular brands do it. If we loose these animals due to our diets, then we will never get them back. This is our one chance to save endangered animals, and we need to act now. Palm Oil is a product used in food items for taste, and is usually unhealthy food. This is our chance to turn the environment around, and show that we care.

attributes.action: Ban the use of disposable BBQs in public places
attributes.background: People are using these disposable BBQs in public places and areas such as national parks and beaches. They have been proven to be the cause of many devastating fires up and down the country and cause damage to the ground upon which they are used and also are often left as litter.
attributes.additional_details: They can be dangerous to the environment, wildlife and put people at risk who are called to extinguish any subsequent fire that they cause. Often they are not taken away as rubbish by those who have used them and they leave behind ugly patches of burnt grass. It seems that the public have no common sense when using these and do not consider the safety of themselves, others or their surroundings by using them. There needs to be a deterrent in the use of these in public places to protect us all.

attributes.action: Open Places of Worship, under social distancing, when we enter risk level 3.
attributes.background: All Places of Worship should be allowed to open for private prayer and devotion, conduct under appropriate social distancing guidelines, at the earliest opportunity, and no later then Jane 1st, when country enters risk level 3, and other sector constraint
attributes.additional_details:
As we begin to relax conditions and open up normal life, particularly non-essential retail, there is no reason not to allow the public to enter places of Worship. Appropriate social distancing guidelines can be put in place, just as has been the case within a variety of environments, and people have demonstrated high levels of compliance.

There are significant risks to the mental health of a many people within the population, places of prayer can only aid many people's mental resilience.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/317856

attributes.action: Keep schools and universities closed until September (AT LEAST) due to COVID-19.
attributes.background: There is talk about schools and universities reopening sometime in June, and out of concern of safety for not only students, but also teachers, it is not sensible to do so as the chance of catching the corona virus will be high, and deaths due to corona are currently still on the rise.
attributes.additional_details: Reopening schools so soon will only cause the number of people infected to skyrocket again, because schools are environments where illness can easily be spread. In addition to this, not only can the virus be caught in schools, but on the journey there and back, especially if a student or teacher requires public transport. Furthermore, as the end of the school year nears, (and when end of year exams/GCSEs/A-Levels would've taken place) it makes more sense to continue home studies until September.

attributes.action: Commit to a 'Green Recovery' as the coronavirus lockdown eases
attributes.background:
The climate is in crisis. While devastating, the covid-19 pandemic has changed public behaviour in ways which have been beneficial to the environment. 

We would like to see the government use the coronavirus lockdown as a springboard to introduce more climate-positive policies across the board.
attributes.additional_details:
The coronoavirus lockdown has reduced reliance on many industries whose activity is harmful to the climate. 

People have made huge changes to their daily lives during lockdown, for instance becoming used to video conferencing. We have learnt it is not always essential to commute to work, or travel to meetings abroad. 

We would like to see policies encouraging a 'green recovery', with  lasting environmental benefits. Dramatic change is needed, and the country has shown we are capable of it.

attributes.action: Ban sky lanterns in the United Kingdom

Paper lanterns aren't safe for animals or the environment. They can cause injury, suffering and death to animals by
ingestion
entanglement
entrapment.
Sky lanterns can cause fires as they use an open flame to float. This risk can destroy habitats and set animal housing, feed and bedding alight

attributes.action: Cancel the debt of maintained schools in UK.
attributes.background: Cancelling the debt of all maintained schools, similar to cancelling NHS debt, will promote better education and enrichment of our children and a better work environment for the teaching profession. Similar benefits would arise from debt cancellation for early years, further education etc
attributes.additional_details:
Schools and Local Authorities have been underfunded due to austerity in the last 10 years. "Since 2009-10, school spending per pupil has fallen by 8% in real-terms in England" - https://www.ifs.org.uk/publications/14345 (Aug 2019)

Schools use taxpayer funding to pay staff, maintain buildings, provide support for vulnerable children and educate and enrich our children. Schools in debt due to under-funding are now paying taxpayers money, intended to educate children, as interest to... banks.

rejection.details:
We understand that you want the Government to change how maintained-schools are funded, but it's unclear if you want the Government to cancel debts between schools and local authorities or central government, or private lending with banks.

The Government could cancel or fund local authorities to cancel debts with local authorities or central government, but for private debts the Government could only provide schools with additional funding so that they can pay these off themselves, as they will be private arrangements between the school and lender.

You could start a new petition calling on the Government to provide funding to enable maintained-schools to pay off their debt, or a similar action.

attributes.action: Require the Environment Agency to suspend the fishing close season
attributes.background:
Require the Environment Agency to suspend the fishing close season for 2020 regarding the coronavirus situation.
People have not much option for fishing because most of the private lakes are closed and most of the canals are heavily polluted especially in the big cities like London.
attributes.additional_details:
Suspend the fishing close season. People need more recreational options for both body and mental health. 
We have a lockdown situation, no gyms, no tennis courts, no swimming pools, no private fishing lakes open. But people could do fishing alone or with one family member

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Make Covid-19 antibody tests available to police and their families
attributes.background: Police officers are putting their lives on the line also by entering dangerous environments with no time for PPE to ensure they are saving life and limb. Let them and their families be tested urgently for the antibody so they know their families are safe whilst they put their lives on the frontline
attributes.additional_details: Our NHS are doing a fantastic job out their on a daily basis, but it feels as though us police are being constantly put down. We are out there doing our day to day role with sometimes no time for PPE if someone’s life is at risk. Whilst this pandemic is ongoing so are cases of domestic violence, murders, attempt murder, rape and many other crimes where fast action is necessary. Help us to help you - ensure we know we are safe.

rejection.details:
We understand that you want the Government to make antibody tests available to police and their family, but it is not clear that this would let police or their families know that they are safe. A positive or negative result for an antibody test would not show that someone was safe from coronavirus.

You could start a new petition calling on the Government to make antibody tests available to police and their family, providing this didn't imply that this would make those people safe from the virus.

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

www.gov.uk/coronavirus
https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

The Government has also created an online service to help you out what you can do if you’re struggling because of coronavirus: https://www.gov.uk/find-coronavirus-support

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips

You can read impartial analysis of the Government response to coronavirus and policy developments here: https://commonslibrary.parliament.uk/coronavirus/

You may also be interested to know that because of the large number of petitions that have been started in relation to coronavirus, the Petitions Committee has been questioning the Government about its response to the coronavirus outbreak.
 
Find out more: https://committees.parliament.uk/work/192/the-governments-response-to-coronavirus/

departments.name: Department of Health and Social Care

attributes.action: Create a voluntary NHS reserve force.
attributes.background: Create a NHS reserve force that can be called upon in case of emergencies and to assist the NHS in applicable roles. This will operate just like retained firefighter or armed force reservists.
attributes.additional_details:
Reserve service provide a great development opportunity.

The training, skills and experiences gained in the reserves can be used to improve performance in the workplace and can enhance skills in areas such as leadership, team work, communication and decision making often in challenging situations and environments. 

This will provide the NHS with additional human resources that it requires.

This is especially important in the events of national health emergencies.

rejection.details:
Since you started this petition, the NHS have launched a call for volunteers and encoruaged retired professional to return to the NHS.

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

NHS website: https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/
UK Government website: https://www.gov.uk/coronavirus

Find out what you can do if you’re struggling because of coronavirus: https://www.gov.uk/find-coronavirus-support

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips

You may also be interested to know that because of the large number of petitions that have been started in relation to coronavirus, the Petitions Committee has been questioning the Government about its response to the coronavirus outbreak. 
 
Find out more and watch the Committee put questions suggested by petitioners to Government Ministers and the Deputy Chief Medical Officer: https://committees.parliament.uk/committee/326/petitions-committee/news/145767/committee-question-deputy-chief-medical-officer-and-ministers-on-coronavirus-response/
 
Read correspondence with Government Ministers asking further questions: https://committees.parliament.uk/committee/326/petitions-committee/publications/3/correspondence/

attributes.action: Raise pay for workers critical to COVID-19 response to at least £2,500 a month
attributes.background: Increase pay to recognise the effort and risk for those doing jobs critical to the coronavirus response. Particularly those working in busy public environments that cannot easily practice social distancing including for example care, hospitals, education, security, supermarkets/food shops.
attributes.additional_details: To reward these workers’ vital roles in recognition of the increased risks for them and their loved ones. They are putting in great effort while others are able to stay safe at home. This impacts their children who must attend school and households deserve recognition. We need to acknowledge those who will step up to perform these roles.

rejection.details:
The Government is not responsible for setting the salary of most key workers, or setting minimum wages for particular sectors, but you may wish to sign petitions calling for the following actions:

Make hazard pay mandatory for key workers in the midst of COVID 19: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/307619

Give all key workers a 100% tax and Nat. Ins. holiday through COVID-19 crisis: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/306845

Pay bonus to all key workers: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/307215

Incentivise NHS staff during the COVID19 outbreak by making wages untaxable: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/304595

Increase pay for NHS healthcare workers and recognise their work: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/300073

Bonus for emergency services personnel working due to COVID-19: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/303306

Make the minimum wage equal for all ages and increase to at least £10: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/301749

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

NHS website: https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/
UK Government website: https://www.gov.uk/coronavirus

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips

You may also be interested to know that because of the large number of petitions that have been started in relation to coronavirus, the Petitions Committee has been questioning the Government about its response to the coronavirus outbreak.

Find out more and watch the Committee put questions suggested by petitioners to Government Ministers and the Deputy Chief Medical Officer: https://committees.parliament.uk/committee/326/petitions-committee/news/145767/committee-question-deputy-chief-medical-officer-and-ministers-on-coronavirus-response/

Read correspondence with Government Ministers asking further questions: https://committees.parliament.uk/committee/326/petitions-committee/publications/3/correspondence/

attributes.action: Exams have been cancelled this year and i believe they should still be sat.
attributes.background: I believe unless they are sat fairness can never be achieved. People miss this chance to develop skills and experience for the future of their education. I believe having Year 11's and 13's go into secondary schools with teachers with them to sit the exams is the best way to still fix this crisis.
attributes.additional_details: I believe what needs to happen is secure environments be created where the students sitting exams can do so with them being assessed and safe from the threat of Corona with everyone supporting them. The current way they wish to do it i believe is just impossible to be seen as fair even though the circumstances does make it somewhat understandable but these years of education they have been through can be questioned and the work they are set over the down period is pointless for them to do.

rejection.details:
Decisions about exams are a matter for exam boards and individual schools, not the UK Government or Parliament. You can read the decision made by exam boards on what will happen to exams here:
https://www.gov.uk/government/news/further-details-on-exams-and-grades-announced

If you want the Government to review the decision to use previous data to calculate exam grades, you may wish to sign this petition:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/306773

As a result of the large numbers of petitions people have tried to start on this issue, and following a large number of questions it received from petitioners about exams, the Petitions Committee asked the Government about the impact of coronavirus on schools and exams.

Watch all the questions and responses:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MmHWDlzlxfA&feature=youtu.be&t=3771

Watch the responses to the following questions:

What was the reasoning behind the timing of school closures?
https://youtu.be/MmHWDlzlxfA#t=1h3m16s

What is happening with exams including GCSEs, A-levels, and SATs?
https://youtu.be/MmHWDlzlxfA#t=1h4m35s

What measures are in place to protect vulnerable children, those on free school meals, and the teachers and other staff who are still working in schools?
https://youtu.be/MmHWDlzlxfA#t=1h7m09s

When might schools re-open?
https://youtu.be/MmHWDlzlxfA#t=1hm12s

Exam cancellations and the current coronavirus pandemic can cause worry and stress. You can find information on how to deal with stress here:

Young Minds:
https://youngminds.org.uk/

Children’s Society:

Childline:
https://www.childline.org.uk/info-advice/your-feelings/anxiety-stress-panic/coping-with-stress/

NHS website:
https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

UK Government website:
https://www.gov.uk/coronavirus

attributes.action: Adopt strict measures to prevent newborns from catching COVID-19 in labour wards
attributes.background:
For staff in labour wards and maternity units to:
- be routinely checked against COVID-19
- wear adequate equipment, including FFP3 masks
- take all necessary precautions, including limiting or banning visits

We also ask that pregnant mothers are tested even in the presence of milder symptoms.
attributes.additional_details:
To date, the evidence on the effects of coronavirus on pregnant women and newborns is very limited. They are a category at risk, as emphasised by the prime minister's speech on Monday 16, 2020. 

The recent infection of a newborn in the Middlesex hospital raises concerns that newborns can be either contract the virus in the womb, or that the environment is not safe enough for mothers (infected or not) delivering their babies.

We ask for more testing and better equipment for maternity NHS staff.

rejection.details: Decisions on treatments and protective measures are decisions for individuals hospital trusts and clinicians and not the UK Government or Parliament.

attributes.action: Stop the ULEZ Expansion to the North and South Circular roads
attributes.background: Stop the extension of the Ultra Low Emissions zone in London to the North and South circular roads on the 21st of October 2021. This coming change will do more harm than good to the environment, people will be forced to scrap their current cars if they do not meet the requirements and buy new ones.
attributes.additional_details: This new legislation greatly effects lower income working class families who may not be able to afford a new car that meets these requirements. Given that many of the areas within this expansion are of the more deprived boroughs within London, this point is exacerbated further.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the issue you raise is not the responsibility of the Government or Parliament. 

Responsibility for Ultra Low Emissions Zone in London is shared between Transport for London and the Greater London Authority. You could submit a petition to the Greater London Authority asking for a response from Transport for London. 

You can find out more about how to petition the GLA here: https://www.london.gov.uk/mayor-assembly/london-assembly/take-part/petitions

attributes.action: Create a new energy market for renewables that is not linked to gas prices.
attributes.background: The energy market needs an overhaul. Renewables and gas pricing should be decoupled from one another. Energy produced by renewables should have its own marketplace and it needs to be done sooner than later.
attributes.additional_details: The energy price hikes prove that the energy market is broken, out of date, and not fit for purpose. When we choose to have our electricity supplied from a renewable source we should not be paying inflated prices due to it being linked to the price of gas.The government needs to intervene in creating a new renewables only market. This will provide much cheaper electricity prices for consumers, enabling more people to reduce their reliance on gas. It's a win for consumers and the environment.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/621874

attributes.action: Ban Disposable Vapes.
attributes.background:
Disposable Vapes Need to be Banned.

They are harmful to you, harmful to the environment, and large portions of their construction involves forced labour through the batteries.

Disposable vapes must be regulated by a government body, taxed additionally to reduce the barrier of entry, or banned.
attributes.additional_details:
Inside each disposable vape is a lithium ion battery, smaller than the one in your phone but equally dangerous. They are fire hazards, full of toxic chemicals which pose extreme risks to the environment and the user, as well as being a waste of precious materials. 

These devices use materials mined and produced through forced labour, and are the same as used in electric cars, and your phone. 

If less of these materials are wasted, there will be less need of slave labour in their production.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

It's not clear if you want disposable vape pens to be better regulated and taxed - and if so how - or banned.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

We also cannot accept petitions that make false or unsubstantiated claims, including assertions about the use of forced labour in the manufacture of vape pens.

attributes.action: Create and enforce minimum inclusive design standards for all types of packaging
attributes.background: Much of current grocery and medication packaging impedes older people as well as people with disabilities. We want the government to legislate for the creation and enforcement of minimum inclusive design standards (akin to the standards for the built environment) for all types of packaging.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action. We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.

We understand you're concerned about improving the functionality of some types of packaging for certain groups of people. However, we're not sure what products you'd like this to cover, or what specific changes to existing design practice you'd like the Government to promote.

attributes.action: Avoid Disposable Vapes going to Landfill by creating Accessible Vape Bins
attributes.background: Provide large bins in Manchester and London for people to be able to dispose of their vapes to avoid them going to landfill. Avoid toxicity of battery acid and lithium being disposed of incorrectly and to give new uses for the plastic used within them.
attributes.additional_details: Lithium-ion and plastic are materials used within disposable vapes that have harsh effects on the environment. There is no education on what to do with vapes once they are finished which creates a grey area for properly disposing of them. If there was a specific place to put vapes, people would have peace of mind knowing the batteries and plastic was going to be used for new material/products i.e. electric cars for lithium-ion and furniture for the plastic.

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about local waste management are a matter for individual local authorities, not the UK Government or Parliament.

You could raise your issue with a local councillor who represents you. You can find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them, by entering your post code here: https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

We could accept a petition calling on the Government to provide funding for particular waste management projects, or to create new legal requirements for local authorities.

attributes.action: Ban Gillnetters over 15m in Scottish waters
attributes.background: We want Government to recognise that gillnetting is one of the most destructive techniques of fishing in the world and we ask for a total ban on industrial gillnetters operating in Scottish waters
attributes.additional_details: Gillnetting kills enormous by-catch and destroys wildlife in a very cruel manner.It has a major negative impact on marine species and fish stocks. It destoy's our shores and beaches with plastic discard. Evidence of tons of discarded fishing gear by EU owned boats is being dredged up on a daily basis by local boats. Please support sustainable responsible fishing, fight to improve the environment and reduce wildlife cruelty caused on an idustrial scale by EU owned gillnetters

rejection.details:
Your petition is about something that the Scottish Government is responsible for. Specifically, the licensing of fishing vessels is the responsibility of Marine Scotland, a Scottish Government agency. This means that the UK Government and Parliament can't look into this issue.

The Scottish Parliament has its own Citizen Participation and Public Petitions Committee. If you'd like to send your petition to the Scottish Parliament, you can find out more here:

http://www.scottish.parliament.uk/gettinginvolved/petitions/index.aspx

attributes.action: End the sale of alcohol in the Palace of Westminster.
attributes.background:
The sale of alcohol to Members of Parliament from catering facilities should be stopped. 
MPs should not have alcohol readily available when they are dealing with serious and complex issues that have the potential to affect millions of people.
attributes.additional_details:
Given the numerous news stories about the conduct of members of government and MPs that has been attributed to alcohol it is only logical to restrict it's availability.
Alcoholic drinks have no place in a working environment.

rejection.details:
You might like to sign the following petition:

Ban the sale and consumption of alcohol on any government/parliamentary estates
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/619523

attributes.action: Stop the sale of peanut and nut products in any business involving children
attributes.background: To stop the sale of peanut and nut products in places such as, children play centres, cinemas, theatres, theme parks etc. places where you use or share, equipment, seating and so on.
attributes.additional_details:
To promote Allergies
To educate people about allergies
All schools aim to be nut free so why not other child friendly environments

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about people with nut allergies, but it's not clear if you want nuts to be banned in all public and private spaces where children are allowed, or just certain types of establishments. It's also not clear if you want the Government to take additional actions to educate people about allergies.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: I want to see all Councils grow wildflowers on grass verges and on roundabouts.
attributes.background:
Planting wildflowers not only looks attractive but it also help the environment and the wildlife.  Councils would save money not having to cut the grass verges & roundabouts for a while.
We need to help the Bees and other insects thrive because the world needs them.
attributes.additional_details: To help the environment issues and the decreasing bee & insect population. It’s a reasonably cheap thing to achieve and the Government could ask & encourage the councils to do this.

rejection.details:
We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Require local authorities replace roadside grass with wild flowers: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/616394

Fund the planting of wildflowers along all public green spaces: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/607277

attributes.action: Stop the overdevelopment of the blue lake in Northfleet, Kent.
attributes.background: The government should protect the local wildlife nature environment as it did for the Swanscombe Peninsula from greed and interests. https://www.kentonline.co.uk/gravesend/news/plans-to-infill-lake-with-thousands-of-homes-267302/?fbclid=IwAR2xqcj8sFJHobNfMvh22B_6hNF2zY7lG0wDfaeH6Veyx7MWYlNyLfdOBwQ
attributes.additional_details: Our natural habitat and environment is threatened daily by the increased level of pollutants we need to preserve the areas that have created a self sustaining natural environment home of many species of wildlife and plants that may not ve able to survive if their habitat is destroyed.

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Local planning decisions are a matter for the relevant local authority, not the UK Government or Parliament.

You could raise your issue with a local councillor who represents you. You can find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them, by entering your post code here:
https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

We have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Suspend major development applications on green belt and protected land: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/616891

attributes.action: NHS wards to have a room for the deceased for relatives
attributes.background:
I want the Government to instruct all NHS hospitals to utilise ward space  to create a room as to allow family members to be with their deceased loved one in a quiet and dignified manner away from other paitents

Currently the system in place is not dignified and hinders the grieving process
attributes.additional_details:
Paitents deserve to be treated with respect dead or alive and other paitents shouldn't need to have their recovery emotionally hindered listening to relatives of the deceased in a distraught manner.

Relatives of the deceased should also be able to grieve in a natural manner during the worst time of their lives without having to worry about showing their emotions in front of ward staff and other paitents, the room for the deceased would enable a better environment for all

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about facilities in NHS wards are a matter for individual NHS Trusts, not the UK Government or Parliament.

You could raise your concern directly with your local NHS Trust. You can find contact details for your local NHS Trust here: https://www.nhs.uk/servicedirectories/pages/nhstrustlisting.aspx

attributes.action: build more cycling lanes around Derbyshire and promote more cycling safety.
attributes.background: I would like the government to fund the construction of new cycling lanes in Derbyshire. In addition, I would like them to fund advertisement to promote cycling safety and cycling in general.
attributes.additional_details: Firstly, cycling lanes create a more safe environment for cyclists. This will encourage more people to cycle rather than drive which is beneficial for peoples health and the environment. Furthermore, it will benefit the governments publicity by getting closer to the net zero goal. Finally, the cycling lanes and safety encouragement will prevent cyclists from getting injured which is significant because of the popularity of cycling around the High Peak/Derbyshire

rejection.details:
You could raise your issue with a local councillor who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them:
https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

attributes.action: Create a no fly zone over Ukraine
attributes.background:
Defend the people in Ukraine from further catastrophic bombardment.
Defend the UK from potential catastrophe as a result of Russian bombing of a nuclear power plant.
attributes.additional_details:
Defence of our fellow human beings should not be dependent on their membership of NATO.
Damage to a nuclear power plant could have a long lasting and devastating impact on our health, safety and our environment.

rejection.details:
You might like to sign the following petition:

Seek to impose a no-fly zone over Ukraine
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/609437

attributes.action: Open a UK coal mine for our domestic heritage sector and export market.
attributes.background:
Steam locomotives are a key attraction in the UK tourism market and is going to suffer massively by the lack of coal in our nation.
Prices will have to increase to import foreign coal (previously sourced from Russia but now unlikely) and that will mean more emissions shopping it around the world.
attributes.additional_details: The UK needs its own coal mine to satisfy the popular heritage sector. Steam engines are a key part of UK tourism & benefits local communities around such attractions with large numbers of customers. Coal in the UK has recently been sourced from mainly Russia & Poland. It is ludicrous that environment protesters object to a UK coal mine but are happy to put it on a boat around the world increasing the carbon footprint massively. There is also a huge export market which will benefit the economy.

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about whether to apply for permission to open a coal mine are a matter for developers, not the UK Government or Parliament. Where the Government is responsible for a decision to approve an application to open a coal mine, we could accept a petition calling on the Government to approve this application.

attributes.action: Say NO to further expansion of Luton Airport
attributes.background: We call upon the UK Government to refuse any application to increase the number of passengers using London Luton Airport (LLA), as this expansion of airport capacity is contrary to the advice of the Climate Change Committee.
attributes.additional_details:
LLA doubled its capacity between 2014 and 2019, creating immense strain on local transport infrastructure, unbearable noise impacts on neighbouring communities and increased greenhouse gas emissions. It did so by ignoring planning conditions which required balanced growth over 15 years.

Now LLA wants to almost double its capacity yet again from 18 million passengers a year to 32 million, despite the Climate Emergency and the impact the increase in flights will have on the environment.

rejection.details:
We understand you're concerned about the expansion of Luton Airport. However there is currently no role for the UK Government or Parliament in determining the expansion of Luton Airport, as the most recent planning application was approved by Luton Council and no subsequent application has been lodged. This means it's not clear what action you want the Government or Parliament to take.

You could have a petition calling on the Government to automatically call in any future planning applications relating to Luton Airport expansion, if that is something you'd like to see happen.

attributes.action: Give dog wardens a better law so a dog doesn't go back to a abused owner.
attributes.background: We need an act of Parliament created in order to prevent all animals from returning to an abusive environment. Dog wardens need more legal rights allowing them to intervene when necessary to reduce the amount of animal abuse cases in the future.
attributes.additional_details: I would like the government to give the dog wardens the right not to give the dogs back to there owners who they know have abused there dog. The dog I found was known to the dog wardens and yet they let the owner take it home I asked them why they didn't report it to the rspca they couldn't answer me I found out because its to time consuming for them.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. Animals can already be removed from owners who treat them abusively. 

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do. We could accept a petition calling for increased funding for animal welfare checks, to make sure that dog wardens and others who work in this area have more time to refer cases and follow-up on them.
